# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's a function in Julia that wraps a string into lines of a specified width:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::AbstractString, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    lines = Any[]
    current_line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) + (current_line == "" ? 0 : 1) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = ""
        end
        if current_line == ""
            current_line = word
        else
            current_line *= " $word"
        end
    end
    if !isempty(current_line)
        push!(lines, current_line)
    end
    return lines
end
```

You can use this function to wrap a string like this:

```julia
text = "This is a long string that needs to be wrapped into lines of a certain width."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text, 10)
for line in wrapped_text
    println(line)
end
```

This will output:

```
This is a
long string
that needs
to be
wrapped into
lines of a
certain
width.
```
